籤詩版本二:
The lush pines and cypresses are flourishing
Rain, snow, wind and frost are always welcome
The future will suddenly become useful
Fame makes pillars
詩意: This hexagram is the image of a dense forest of pines and cypresses. There is nobility in everything.
解曰: Good luck on the road. Lifelong meritorious service. The field silkworms are ripe. The family is prosperous.
籤詩故事一:
◇Fan Wenzheng decided to harrow and draw porridge
Fan Zhongyan, a famous official in the Song Dynasty, came from a poor family when he was young. He studied in a monk's residence in Changbai Mountain. He cooked porridge with two liters of millet every day. After it solidified overnight, he cut it into four pieces with a knife. He ate two pieces in the morning and evening, and cut some pickles to eat.
This is used to describe someone who is not afraid of hardships, studies hard, and eventually becomes a talent of great use.
Cut off the harrow and draw porridge
聖意:
Jiazhai is lucky.
Self-successful.
Seeking wealth and peace.
Trading is booming.
Marriage is completed.
Rokko Male.
Pedestrian: Have faith.
Tiancan: Profit.


Six animals are damaged.
Looking for someone to come.
The lawsuit is justified.
Migration is lucky.
Lost things are seen.
Disease: An.
Mountain tomb is auspicious.
古人: Fan Wenzheng decides to harrow and draw porridge
